main event: A large round, bright object was sighted near Harlowtown, Mont. on August 8, 1954. The object changed colors, flashing oranges, blues, and reds, and was continuously glowing and very bright. It was observed for one hour before gradually fading out.
interesting points: The object was reported to be 'zero zebra', potentially meaning it had no discernible features.
Several reliable witnesses, including Dr. Thirty-one, a medical doctor from Harlowtown, Montana, observed the sighting.
A twenty-power sighting scope was used by the observer to visually observe the object for several minutes.
There were no unusual conditions or activity to account for the sighting.
The report suggests the sighting may have corresponded to the planet Mars.
witnesses: Dr. Thirty-one and several other reliable witnesses
